UI_visible_response: Read 109 web pagesView Page DetailsThe zero-COVID policy had a wide range of effects, including the following:Positive EffectsEffective Containment of the Virus: The policy significantly reduced the number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in China, effectively containing the scale and spread of the initial outbreak in 2020 to the minimum level and avoiding an overwhelmed and overloaded health system.Economic Resurgence: In contrast to the experiences of the United States, Canada, and several European nations in 2020, China's zero-COVID policy led to an economic resurgence.Improved Academic Performance for Boys: The stringency of the zero-COVID policy was associated with significantly better mathematics performance for boys aged 6 to 15, while having no effects on girls.Negative EffectsImpact on the Labor Market: A 10% increase in the Zero-Covid Policy Interventions heightened the probability of unemployment by around 0.1 percentage points. The policy also decreased working hours for employed individuals.Disruption to Daily Life: The policy led to significant disruptions in daily life, including lockdowns and school closures.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: The zero-COVID policy had a wide range of effects, including the following:### Positive Effects- **Effective Containment of the Virus**: The policy significantly reduced the number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in China, effectively containing the scale and spread of the initial outbreak in 2020 to the minimum level and avoiding an overwhelmed and overloaded health system[^1^].- **Economic Resurgence**: In contrast to the experiences of the United States, Canada, and several European nations in 2020, China's zero-COVID policy led to an economic resurgence[^3^].- **Improved Academic Performance for Boys**: The stringency of the zero-COVID policy was associated with significantly better mathematics performance for boys aged 6 to 15, while having no effects on girls[^2^].### Negative Effects- **Impact on the Labor Market**: A 10% increase in the Zero-Covid Policy Interventions heightened the probability of unemployment by around 0.1 percentage points[^1^]. The policy also decreased working hours for employed individuals[^1^].- **Disruption to Daily Life**: The policy led to significant disruptions in daily life, including lockdowns and school closures[^2^].
